Pre-Game Insights: Hungary have improved in class and are considered a strong team, but failed to qualify for the 2022 World Cup. Bosnia have only qualified for one major tournament in their history and disappointed in the last cycle.
In the new cycle, Hungary began with a loss against Germany, while Bosnia lost against the Netherlands.
Post-Match Reflections: Not applicable as the match has not occurred.
Others: The match will be played on Tuesday, September 10th at Puskás Aréna (Budapest). The teams have played friendlies in 1999 and 2001, both ending in draws. However, in the Euro 2008 qualifiers, the 'Magyars' won both encounters.
